intro: Vaccinium sangtavanense, commonly known as the Sangtavan huckleberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, white to pink flowers. Its berries, which are typically red or black when mature, are edible and have a tart flavor. This plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
